TOPIC: E.1. Data Governance—Strategic/Qualitative

Activity: Identify and define high-level RDM organizational goals
Outcomes (see comment): E.1.1 Identification of goals and roles: goals identified and defined
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Overarching goal statements
Participants: VPR, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean

TOPIC:
The policies, procedures, and processes pertaining to authority, control,
and shared decision-making (planning, monitoring, and enforcement) over the management of data assets
SUBTOPIC: E.1.1 Identification of goals and roles
Activity: Identify and define roles and responsibilities for each RDaF topic: E.1, E.2, E.3, E.4., E.5, E.6
Outcomes (see comment): E.1.1 Identification of goals and roles: roles and responsibilities are identified and defined
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): RACI matrix, Data Curation Roles Planning Matrix
Participants: VPR, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean
Guiding documents: Research Data Curation: A Framework for an Institution-Wide Services Approach (educause.edu)

Activity: Define organizational vision for research data
Outcomes (see comment): Organization has a clearly defined vision for research data management
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.1.2 Vision and/or policy: Vision statement
Participants: VPR, VPRED, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean, Chief Medical Informatics Officer, Office of Research Advancement

Activity: Define organizational policy infrastructure for research data
Outcomes (see comment): Organization has a clearly defined high-level policies for research data management
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.1.2 Vision and/or policy: Data policies
Participants: VPR, VPRED, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean, Chief Medical Informatics Officer, Office of Research Advancement

Activity: Create data governance group
Outcomes (see comment): E.1.3 Data management organization: Data governance policies, framework, and plans exist and are updated as needed
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Data governance policies, framework, and plans exist
Participants: VPR, VPRED, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean, Chief Medical Informatics Officer, Office of Research Advancement
Method: Create Data Governance Council, Data Stewardship Council

Activity: Define organizational value for research data
Outcomes (see comment): Organization has a clearly defined value statement
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.1.5 Data management value proposition
Participants: VPR, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean

Activity: Conduct data needs assessments
Outcomes (see comment): Data needs assessment completed at the desired level of analysis: researcher, student, discipline, institution, unit, library
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.1.6 Data needs assessment: Data Needs Assessment document(s)
Participants: VPR, Library Dean, Researchers, CIO, Student
Method: Needs assessments, stakeholder survey, investigate number of, size, publishing location of datasets, investigate existing grant funded projects and grants

SUBTOPIC: E.1.7 Purpose and value of data
Outcomes (see comment): E.1.7 Purpose and value of data: well defined across the institution
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Vision statement

SUBTOPIC: E.1.8 Organization intent regarding FAIR data
Outcomes (see comment): E.1.8 Organization intent regarding FAIR data: well defined across the institution and contributes to vision and policy
Participants: VPR, VPRED, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean, Chief Medical Informatics Officer, Office of Research Advancement

TOPIC: E.2 Data Governance—Legal and Regulatory Compliance
The policies, procedures, and processes to manage and monitor an organization’s regulatory [and] legal responsibilities and risks pertaining to data.

Activity: Conduct a dataset inventory
Outcomes (see comment): Inventory includes relevant dataset metadata including: repository, identifiers, data usage metrics, creators, funders, supporting grants
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.2.4 Inventory: Dataset inventory
Participants: IT Head, Librarian

Activity: Conduct a data services inventory
Outcomes (see comment): Inventory includes relevant data services provided across institution or unit
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.2.4 Inventory: Data Services inventory
Participants: IT Head, Librarian, Department Heads
Exemplar@SUNY: Engage with Security Operations Center (SOC) Information Security Working Group, Enterprise Risk Management Committee
Guiding documents: Research Data Curation: A Framework for an Institution-Wide Services Approach (educause.edu), https://sr.ithaka.org/publications/research-data-services-in-us-higher-education/

Activity: Conduct a risk assessment
Outcomes (see comment): E.2.5 Risk assessment: Risk assessment includes risks associated with unmanaged data, research subject privacy, data preservation, funder compliance
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Risk Assessment
Participants: CISO, CIO, Chief Officer for Risk and Compliance
Method: Many Risk Assessment tools and framework (NISTIR 8062)

Activity: Implement solutions to mitigate and manage risk discovered in risk assessment
Outcomes (see comment): E.2.6 Risk mitigation and management: Risks determined in risk assessment are mitigated, managed, and controlled
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Risk mitigation plan, Data Governance plans
Participants: CISO, CIO, Chief Officer for Risk and Compliance

SUBTOPIC: E.2.8 Social license for use and reuse
E.2.9 Jurisdiction for sharing and reuse
Participants: Counsel

TOPIC: E.3 Data Culture and Reward Structure
Activity: Define roles and responsibilities for building a strong data sharing culture and rewards structure
Outcomes (see comment): E.3.1 Roles and responsibilities: Institution demonstrates a strong data sharing culture and rewards structure
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): RACI matrix, Data Curation Roles Planning Matrix
Participants: VPR, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean, HR, Department Chairs, Students, Faculty Senate

TOPIC: The collective beliefs and behaviors of the people in an organization concerning the value and management of research data. Practices designed to recognize the advantages and accomplishments of sharing data.
Activity: Build a data culture
Outcomes (see comment): E.3.2 Recognition of data management to build a Data Culture
Participants: VPR, Campus Provost, Library Dean, HR, Librarians, Researchers

Activity: Build a data culture
Outcomes (see comment): E.3.3 Data workers are valued
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Recognition for data sharing and open data through awards, professional expectations, data metrics, promotion
Participants: HR, Faculty, Administrators

Activity: Build a data culture
Outcomes (see comment): E.3.4 Promotion and tenure reflect the importance of open research and scholarship
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Data sharing is incentivized in promotion and tenure work through use of data metrics and open publishing, community engagement
Participants: VPR, Campus Provost, CIO, Library Dean, HR, Department Chairs, Students, Faculty Senate

SUBTOPIC: E.3.5 Integrity of research and data
Activity: Follow standard practices to ensure research and outputs maintain integrity
Outcomes (see comment): Outcomes from related subtopics
Participants: Librarians, Researchers

Activity: Perform accuracy checks on all shared or published datasets, Create README files
Outcomes (see comment): E.3.5 Integrity of research and data
Participants: Librarians, Researchers

Outcomes (see comment): E.3.6 FAIR data principles are followed

SUBTOPIC: E.3.8 Incentives and impact for sharing and reuse
E.3.9 Disincentives for sharing and reuse

Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Statement on Indigenous ethics of ownership

TOPIC: E.4 Education and Workforce Development
Activity: Conduct a Workforce skills inventory to determine an organization's internal capacity to conduct and support RDM
Outcomes (see comment): Strengths and weaknesses in workforce capacity to conduct RDM at institution are documented
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.4.1 Workforce skills inventory (internal)

TOPIC: Training to provide staff with the necessary skills and expertise for data-related activities and RDM. Includes leadership support and formal and informal training.
Activity: Conduct a Workforce skills inventory to determine needs for students to build workforce skills to conduct or support RDM
Outcomes (see comment): Strengths and weaknesses in workforce capacity to conduct RDM across NYS are documented
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.4.1 Workforce skills inventory (state):  Inventory of state workforce needs that can be addressed through education
Participants: Department Deans, Provost

SUBTOPIC: E.4.2 Workforce preparedness in new and advanced technologies
Activity: Provide training and opportunities for employees to build their skills and expertise in emerging technologies
Outcomes (see comment): Institution can support RDM through appropriately skilled staff
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.4.2 Workforce preparedness in new and advanced technologies (internal): Suite of internal workforce training offered

Activity: Build workforce preparedness programs for emerging technologies for state workforce
Outcomes (see comment): State Workforce is well prepared to adapt and innovate in response to emerging technologies
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.4.2 Workforce preparedness in new and advanced technologies (State): Educational programs equip students to work with data and emerging technologies

Activity: Provide research data management training as a data service
Outcomes (see comment): RDM training is available for organizational participants
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.4.3 Data management training
Participants: Librarians, IT, Research and Economic Development
Method: Asynchronous web-based training, short courses, integrated training in education offerings

SUBTOPIC: E.4.4 HR’s supporting role in workforce development and training
Activity: Provide research data management training to data service providers
Outcomes (see comment): E.4.4 HR’s supporting role in workforce development and training: RDM training for data services providers exists
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.4.3 Data management training
Participants: HR, Librarians, IT, Research and Economic Development
Method: Data curation, preservation, management training opportunities inform providers of RDM services

SUBTOPIC: E.4.5 Promotional paths and career development

TOPIC:
E.5 Resources—Allocation and Sustainability
The distribution and longevity of funding to attain and maintain robust research data programs and RDM infrastructure.
Activity: Determine initial financial support models to launch RDM infrastructure
Outcomes (see comment): RDM is funded through dedicated streams (may be temporary)
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.5.1 Sources of funding discovered and captured
Participants: Finance, Research and Economic Development, VPR, Provost

Activity: Integrate RDM costs into sustainable financial models
Outcomes (see comment): RDM funding is operationalized
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): E.5.2 Long-term funding integrated into budget
Participants: Finance, Research and Economic Development, VPR, Provost

Activity: Increase existing staff skills in RDM, redeploy existing staff, or hire new staff members with RDM skills
Outcomes (see comment): E.5.3. Staffing is considered in resource allocation
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Organization chart
Participants: HR, Finance, Research and Economic Development, VPR, Provost

TOPIC: E.6 Community Engagement
Activity: Build Stakeholder communities of practice: local, campus, system, national, international
Outcomes (see comment): E.6.1 Stakeholder communities exist
Milestone Indicator (Outputs): Active communities of practice exist along continuum of emergent data community to established data community
Participants: Librarians, Researchers, Faculty, Administration
Method: Communities of Practice, Task Groups, Mentor models, GRANTED work
Exemplar@SUNY: GRANTED, Data Curation Network, SUNY campus groups, SUNY system groups
Guiding documents: Leveraging Data Communities to Advance Open Science - Ithaka S+R

TOPIC: Outreach and interactions among organizations or individuals with shared goals or interests concerning research data activities or RDM
Activity: Establish communication channels
Outcomes (see comment): E.6.2 Modes of communication: established

Activity: Map potential local stakeholders and partners
Outcomes (see comment): E.6.3 Partners/partnerships: considered and documented

SUBTOPIC: E.6.4 Engagement across knowledge domains and sectors
E.6.6 Data services and the beneficiaries

TOPIC:
P.1 Chain of Control (Custody of Data)
A complete, fully documented step-by-step history of a data asset in an organization, i.e., who has possession of a data asset, at what time, and for what purpose, at all times throughout the lifecycle of the data asset.

SUBTOPIC: P.1.3 Centralized inventory of services, groups, and resources

TOPIC:
P.2 Financial Aspects of Planning
Factors to consider in estimating or assessing the costs associated with all research data and RDM activities over the data lifecycle.
SUBTOPIC: P.2.1 Funding models for provisioning resources
Guiding documents: Funding Models: Funding Data Governance - The Data Governance Institute

SUBTOPIC: P.2.3 Decision-making tools to assess costs
P.2.5 Cost breakdown by lifecycle stage

TOPIC:
P.3 Data Management Planning
The process of organizing and specifying objectives and activities throughout the research data lifecycle.

SUBTOPIC: P.3.2 Purpose/intent of research study and context of anticipated data use
P.3.3 Specification of data objects, metadata, analysis tools, and workflows throughout the lifecycle
P.3.5 Linkage of DMPs to administrative records
P.3.6 Data organization in, e.g., a database and a repository, to facilitate future access
P.3.7 Data management expertise and training

TOPIC:
P.4 Data Objects
An entity that, together with associated Representative Information (i.e., metadata), is produced or used in a research study

SUBTOPIC: P.4.2 Measurements, including images, audio recordings, and photos/videos

TOPIC:
P.5 FAIR
Findability, Accessibility, Interoperability, Reuse: a set of guiding principles to support the reusability of data that are beneficial to all scholarly digital research objects.
SUBTOPIC: P.5.1 Organizational support for making data more FAIR
P.5.2 Identification of methods/guidelines vis-à-vis FAIR principles

TOPIC:
P.6 Data/Metadata Considerations
Factors to take into account prior to conducting a research study
SUBTOPIC: P.6.1 Criteria for selection of data/metadata
P.6.4 Methods to capture and store data/metadata

TOPIC:
P.7 Data Architecture
The fundamental structure of an organization's research data management (RDM) system embodied in its components, their relationships to each other and to the environment, and the principles guiding its design and evolution. Includes, for example, the underlying storage technologies, networking, hardware, system interfaces, authentication mechanisms, data brokers, monitoring platforms, semantic interoperability tools, long-term preservation services, and HPC.

SUBTOPIC: P.7.6 Hosting and storage, cloud storage

TOPIC:
P.8 Hardware and Software Infrastructure
The physical and non-physical functional components that collectively form a foundation for conducting research and RDM

SUBTOPIC: P.8.2 Tools to support data-related processes
P.8.3 Models that connect infrastructure to data processes and workflow
P.8.6 Sustainability of data vis-à-vis obsolete infrastructure
P.8.8 Staff expertise and support staff

TOPIC:
P.9 Research Data Standards
Documents, including codes, specifications, recommended practices, classifications, test methods and guides, that describe how data should be stored or exchanged for the consistent collection and interoperability of that data across different systems, sources, and users.
SUBTOPIC: P.9.1 Criteria, i.e., general vs. domain-specific standards
P.9.2 Sources of standards/guidelines for data/metadata

TOPIC:
P.10 Assessment
Evaluation of the success of a research project against expectations set before the project has started
Activity: Assess Milestone Achievement and Indicator status
Outcomes (see comment): P.10.1 Goals/definition of success defined in E.1.1: Dashboards, KPI, Metrics reviewed a specific time designations for comparison

SUBTOPIC: P.10.2 Metrics for tracking use and impact measures, including reuse
Activity: Create and use data metrics
Outcomes (see comment): P.10.2 Metrics for tracking use and impact measures, including reuse: Data metrics are used to support data culture
Participants: Librarians, Researchers, Faculty, Administration, VPR

TOPIC:
P.11 Communication and Outreach
Engagement and interactions among groups and Individual working in similar research areas
SUBTOPIC: P.11.1 Methods to share and reuse data/metadata
P.11.2 Allocation of credit to project team members
P.11.3 Promotion of data to communities of interest
P.11.5 Requests for additional data from community

TOPIC:
P.12 Access Control Associated with Data Sensitivity
Methods and requirements to limit the individuals and groups permitted to view or use protected data.
SUBTOPIC: P.12.1 Identification of responsible parties for access
P.12.2 Ease of maintenance and implementation of records

TOPIC:
GA.1 Data Types
Classifications or categories of data, each with unique collection, generation, and storage challenges
SUBTOPIC: GA.1.1 Measurements, including images, audio recordings, photos/videos

TOPIC:
GA.2 Data Sources
Where and from which processes data originates

SUBTOPIC: GA.2.4 User facility generation by/for researcher

TOPIC:
GA.3 Generated Experimental Data
Collection of information through active intervention by the researcher to induce and measure changes or to create differences when a variable is altered

SUBTOPIC: GA.3.4 Specification of instruments and tools
GA.3.5 Parameters for instruments and tools

TOPIC:
GA.4 Generated Computational Data
Production of information resulting from executing a computer model or simulation

SUBTOPIC: GA.4.4 Parameters and conditions for computation

TOPIC:
GA.5 Qualitative Data
Non-ordinal and focusing on qualities or characteristics

GA.6 Acquired Data
Obtained from a source outside of the researchers and which was not originally collected for the current research project

SUBTOPIC: GA.6.4 Aggregated datasets from multiple sources
GA.6.6 Restrictions, fees, and usage agreements

TOPIC:
GA.7 Critically Evaluated (CE) Data
Collected and processed in a standardized way with rigorous methodology to serve as a standard
SUBTOPIC: GA.7.1 Infrastructure to assure the greatest data integrity
GA.7.3 Aggregation of data evaluated by experts

TOPIC:
GA.8 FAIR Principles
Compliance with a set of guiding principles proposed by a consortium of scientists and organizations to support the reusability of digital assets

SUBTOPIC: GA.8.4 FAIR on a continuous scale
GA.8.5 Guidelines/methodologies for each aspect: F, A, I, R
GA.8.6 Tools to capture FAIR provenance
GA.8.8 Not FAIR data (e.g., legacy data)

TOPIC:
GA.9 Community-Based Standards
Technical specifications for encoding metadata for machine processing and exchange

SUBTOPIC: GA.9.2 Standards development organizations vs. community consensus
GA.9.3 Data format and file structure
GA.9.4 Metadata format and file structure

TOPIC:
GA.10 Acquisition Software
Programs that enable the collection and procurement of data
